item.title: Game Dev VM Marketplace Application will be retired on February 1st, 2024
item.description: Announcement of Azure Game Dev VM retirement
item.atom:content: Announcement of Azure Game Dev VM retirement

item.title: Public Preview: Azure integration with Canonical’s Snapshot Service for safe deployment
item.description: Azure Guest Patching Service and Azure Kubernetes Service will now apply the same package update from a specific date to all regions following safe deployment principles.
item.atom:content: Azure Guest Patching Service and Azure Kubernetes Service will now apply the same package update from a specific date to all regions following safe deployment principles.

item.title: Generally available: Azure Premium SSD v2 Disk Storage is now available in more regions
item.description: Azure Premium SSD v2 Disk Storage is now available in more regions and offers the most advanced general-purpose block storage solution with the best price performance
item.atom:content: Azure Premium SSD v2 Disk Storage is now available in more regions and offers the most advanced general-purpose block storage solution with the best price performance

item.title: TLS 1.2 to become the minimum TLS version for Azure Storage
item.description: TLS 1.2 to become the minimum TLS version for Azure Storage
item.atom:content: TLS 1.2 to become the minimum TLS version for Azure Storage

item.title: GA: gRPC support on Azure App Service
item.description: Host your gRPC workloads on App Service Linux.
item.atom:content: Host your gRPC workloads on App Service Linux.

item.title: General availability: Default Rule Set 2.1 for regional WAF with Application Gateway
item.description: Increase your security posture and reduce false positives with Default Rule Set 2.1, now generally available on the regional WAF with Application Gateway
item.atom:content: Increase your security posture and reduce false positives with Default Rule Set 2.1, now generally available on the regional WAF with Application Gateway

item.title: Public preview: Announcing the new Azure Bastion Developer SKU
item.description: The Bastion Developer SKU represents a novel, cost-effective, and streamlined version of the Bastion service.
item.atom:content: The Bastion Developer SKU represents a novel, cost-effective, and streamlined version of the Bastion service.

item.title: New E-mail templates for Log search alerts - API version 2021-08-01 and up
item.description: During November, we will replace log search alerts (API version 2021-08-01 and up) that uses non-common schema template with an upgraded and more informative email template.
item.atom:content: During November, we will replace log search alerts (API version 2021-08-01 and up) that uses non-common schema template with an upgraded and more informative email template.

item.title: Generally available: Azure Blob Storage Cold Tier support on Blob Batch operations
item.description: Azure Blob Batch operations now support Azure Blob Storage Cold Tier.
item.atom:content: Azure Blob Batch operations now support Azure Blob Storage Cold Tier.

item.title: General availability: Azure Sphere OS version 23.10 expected on November 8
item.description: Participate in retail evaluation now to ensure compatibility. The Azure Sphere team has also updated the trusted keystore of Azure Sphere devices, resulting in an additional reboot for production devices.
item.atom:content: Participate in retail evaluation now to ensure compatibility. The Azure Sphere team has also updated the trusted keystore of Azure Sphere devices, resulting in an additional reboot for production devices.

item.title: Public preview: Traffic Splitting for Azure Static Web Apps
item.description: Split traffic to your Azure Static Web Apps across multiple environments to gradually rollout features and compare versions being tested.
item.atom:content: Split traffic to your Azure Static Web Apps across multiple environments to gradually rollout features and compare versions being tested.

item.title: Public preview: Snippets for Azure Static Web Apps
item.description: Inject snippets into your website’s pages to add analytics, customizations and integrations, or to optimize performance without changing your source code.
item.atom:content: Inject snippets into your website’s pages to add analytics, customizations and integrations, or to optimize performance without changing your source code.

item.title: GA: Performance optimizations for the isolated worker model in .NET Azure Functions
item.description: Major cold start improvements are available to .NET apps on the Azure Functions isolated worker model.
item.atom:content: Major cold start improvements are available to .NET apps on the Azure Functions isolated worker model.

item.title: GA: Service Bus message settlement in isolated worker model for .NET Azure Functions
item.description: Functions using the ServiceBusTrigger can perform message settlement actions in the isolated worker model for .NET applications
item.atom:content: Functions using the ServiceBusTrigger can perform message settlement actions in the isolated worker model for .NET applications

item.title: Public preview: Disable Secure Shell (SSH) support in AKS
item.description: You can now disable secure shell (SSH) in AKS
item.atom:content: You can now disable secure shell (SSH) in AKS

item.title: GA: Bring our own keys (BYOK) on Ephemeral OS Disk
item.description: You can now encrypt OS and Data disks of your AKS nodes in production with your own managed keys.
item.atom:content: You can now encrypt OS and Data disks of your AKS nodes in production with your own managed keys.

item.title: Public preview: Azure NetApp Files standard storage with cool access
item.description: Azure NetApp Files standard storage with cool access is now in public preview. With the new cool access feature, you can enable standard volumes with the ability to transparently store data more cost-effectively on Azure storage accounts based on its access pattern.
item.atom:content: Azure NetApp Files standard storage with cool access is now in public preview. With the new cool access feature, you can enable standard volumes with the ability to transparently store data more cost-effectively on Azure storage accounts based on its access pattern.

item.title: Protect SQL Server 2014 workloads with Extended Security Updates
item.description: SQL Server 2014 will reach its end of ten-year product lifecycle on July 9th, 2024. To provide you with the flexibility to stay secure while you plan for the future, we are announcing SQL Server 2014 Extended Security Updates.
item.atom:content: SQL Server 2014 will reach its end of ten-year product lifecycle on July 9th, 2024. To provide you with the flexibility to stay secure while you plan for the future, we are announcing SQL Server 2014 Extended Security Updates.

item.title: Public preview: Built-in Azure Monitor alerts for Azure Site Recovery
item.description: Learn about the new and improved alerting capabilities offered for Azure Site Recovery, via Azure Monitor
item.atom:content: Learn about the new and improved alerting capabilities offered for Azure Site Recovery, via Azure Monitor

item.title: General availability: Storage auto-grow & online disk scaling for Azure Database for PostgreSQL - Flexible Server
item.description: With auto-grow enabled, Azure Database for PostgreSQL - Flexible Server will automatically increase the size of your provisioned storage.
item.atom:content: With auto-grow enabled, Azure Database for PostgreSQL - Flexible Server will automatically increase the size of your provisioned storage.

item.title: General availability: Latest PostgreSQL minor versions supported by Azure Database for PostgreSQL - Flexible Server
item.description: Azure Database for PostgreSQL – Flexible Server now supports minor versions 15.4, 14.9, 13.12, 12.16, 11.21.
item.atom:content: Azure Database for PostgreSQL – Flexible Server now supports minor versions 15.4, 14.9, 13.12, 12.16, 11.21.

item.title: Public preview: Flush data operation for Azure Cache for Redis
item.description: Basic, Standard, and Premium tier caches now support a built-in flush operation that can be started as a management operation.
item.atom:content: Basic, Standard, and Premium tier caches now support a built-in flush operation that can be started as a management operation.

item.title: General availability: Azure Synapse Link for existing MongoDB collections
item.description: Azure Synapse Link for Azure Cosmos DB enables near real time analytics, now available for existing MongoDB collections in Azure Cosmos DB for Mongo DB.
item.atom:content: Azure Synapse Link for Azure Cosmos DB enables near real time analytics, now available for existing MongoDB collections in Azure Cosmos DB for Mongo DB.

item.title: Public preview: Update channel for Basic, Standard and Premium Caches
item.description: Receive early updates by configuring the update channel for your Basic, Standard and Premium tier cache instances.
item.atom:content: Receive early updates by configuring the update channel for your Basic, Standard and Premium tier cache instances.

item.title: General availability: Azure Synapse Link compatibility with Cosmos DB continuous backup
item.description: Now Azure Cosmos DB customers using continuous backup can enable Synapse Link in their database accounts.
item.atom:content: Now Azure Cosmos DB customers using continuous backup can enable Synapse Link in their database accounts.

item.title: General availability: PostgreSQL 16 production support in Azure Cosmos DB for PostgreSQL
item.description: You can now choose PostgreSQL 16 when creating PostgreSQL clusters in Azure Cosmos DB for PostgreSQL, a managed service for distributed Postgres database.
item.atom:content: You can now choose PostgreSQL 16 when creating PostgreSQL clusters in Azure Cosmos DB for PostgreSQL, a managed service for distributed Postgres database.

item.title: The availability of Azure compute reservations exchanges extended until at least July 1st, 2024
item.description: The availability of Azure compute reservations exchanges extended until at least July 1st, 2024
item.atom:content: The availability of Azure compute reservations exchanges extended until at least July 1st, 2024

item.title: Microsoft Security email update and Resources for Azure AD rename to Microsoft Entra ID
item.description:
Microsoft Entra ID is the new name for Azure Active Directory (Azure AD). The rename and new product icon are being rolled out across experiences from Microsoft. Most updates will be complete by mid-November of this year. Resources are also now available to support the renaming of your product experiences.
Additionally, Identity emails will now be sent from Microsoft Security (MSSecurity-noreply@microsoft.com). The emails are currently coming from Microsoft Azure (azure-noreply@microsoft.com). You may need to update Outlook rules as a result.
item.atom:content:
Microsoft Entra ID is the new name for Azure Active Directory (Azure AD). The rename and new product icon are being rolled out across experiences from Microsoft. Most updates will be complete by mid-November of this year. Resources are also now available to support the renaming of your product experiences.
Additionally, Identity emails will now be sent from Microsoft Security (MSSecurity-noreply@microsoft.com). The emails are currently coming from Microsoft Azure (azure-noreply@microsoft.com). You may need to update Outlook rules as a result.

item.title: Changes to My Groups admin controls
item.description: New settings will enable admins to restrict end users from viewing and editing security groups in My Groups. The existing settings that allow enabling or disabling of My Groups will be retired in June 2024.
item.atom:content: New settings will enable admins to restrict end users from viewing and editing security groups in My Groups. The existing settings that allow enabling or disabling of My Groups will be retired in June 2024.

item.title: Generally available: Zone Redundant Storage for Azure Disks is now available in more regions
item.description: Zone Redundant Storage (ZRS) for Azure Disks is now available on Azure Premium SSD and Standard SSD in Norway East and UAE North regions.
item.atom:content: Zone Redundant Storage (ZRS) for Azure Disks is now available on Azure Premium SSD and Standard SSD in Norway East and UAE North regions.

item.title: Default outbound access for VMs in Azure will be retired— updates and more information
item.description: Default outbound access connectivity for virtual machines will be retired in September 2025 -- updates and more information
item.atom:content: Default outbound access connectivity for virtual machines will be retired in September 2025 -- updates and more information

item.title: General Availability: Azure AI Content Safety
item.description:
Azure AI Content Safety, now generally available, is a service that enables developers to build safer online environments by detecting and assigning severity scores to unsafe images and text across content categories and languages. These capabilities empower businesses to effectively prioritize and streamline the review of both human and AI-generated content, enabling the responsible development of next-generation AI applications.
Learn more: https://aka.ms/contentsafety
Get started in Azure AI Content Safety Studio: https://aka.ms/contentsafetystudio
item.atom:content:
Azure AI Content Safety, now generally available, is a service that enables developers to build safer online environments by detecting and assigning severity scores to unsafe images and text across content categories and languages. These capabilities empower businesses to effectively prioritize and streamline the review of both human and AI-generated content, enabling the responsible development of next-generation AI applications.
Learn more: https://aka.ms/contentsafety
Get started in Azure AI Content Safety Studio: https://aka.ms/contentsafetystudio

item.title: Public Preview: VMSS Automatic Instance Repairs - Reimage, Restart Repair Actions
item.description: New recovery options available on automatic instance repairs provides the capability for less-disruptive repair actions on sensitive workloads.
item.atom:content: New recovery options available on automatic instance repairs provides the capability for less-disruptive repair actions on sensitive workloads.

item.title: Azure Machine Learning - General Availability for October
item.description: Three features now available in GA enable you to streamline your network isolation experience, deploy your model locally prior to production, and automate the ML lifecycle without accruing extra compute hours or requiring manual intervention.
item.atom:content: Three features now available in GA enable you to streamline your network isolation experience, deploy your model locally prior to production, and automate the ML lifecycle without accruing extra compute hours or requiring manual intervention.

item.title: Azure Machine Learning - Public Preview for October
item.description: Four features now available in Public Preview enable you to customize your compute instance experience by using curated or custom environments, collect all model dependencies in a single operation to generate a package than can be move and deployed across environments, label your images at each pixel level with high quality, and conenct and fine-tune Azure OpenAI models with Azure Machine Learning.
item.atom:content: Four features now available in Public Preview enable you to customize your compute instance experience by using curated or custom environments, collect all model dependencies in a single operation to generate a package than can be move and deployed across environments, label your images at each pixel level with high quality, and conenct and fine-tune Azure OpenAI models with Azure Machine Learning.

item.title: Azure Functions support for Python 3.8 is ending on 14 October 2024
item.description: Upgrade Azure Functions to use Python 3.9 or above.
item.atom:content: Upgrade Azure Functions to use Python 3.9 or above.

item.title: Windows Server 2012/R2 reaches end of support
item.description: Windows Server 2012/R2 reaches end of support today on October 10, 2023. Microsoft has several options for organizations to remain protected.
item.atom:content: Windows Server 2012/R2 reaches end of support today on October 10, 2023. Microsoft has several options for organizations to remain protected.

item.title: Generally Available: Azure Dedicated Host - Resize
item.description: Resize capability for Azure dedicated hosts is now generally available
item.atom:content: Resize capability for Azure dedicated hosts is now generally available

item.title: Breaking Change Notice: Virtual Machine Scale Set Default Orchestration Mode changing from Uniform to Flexible on PowerShell, Azure CLI
item.description: Starting November 2023, Virtual Machine Scale Sets created on PowerShell and Azure CLI will automatically default to Flexible orchestration mode.
item.atom:content: Starting November 2023, Virtual Machine Scale Sets created on PowerShell and Azure CLI will automatically default to Flexible orchestration mode.

item.title: Private Preview: Regional Disaster Recovery by Azure Backup for AKS
item.description: Customers can now utilize Azure Backup for AKS to recover their containerized applications and data during a regional disaster scenario.
item.atom:content: Customers can now utilize Azure Backup for AKS to recover their containerized applications and data during a regional disaster scenario.

item.title: General Availability: Azure Private Link for MySQL – Flexible Server
item.description: Use Azure Private Link for private connectivity with MySQL – Flexible Server.
item.atom:content: Use Azure Private Link for private connectivity with MySQL – Flexible Server.

item.title: General Availability: Universal cross-region read replica on Azure Database for MySQL - Flexible Server
item.description: Provision up to 10 read replicas in universal regions on Azure Database for MySQL - Flexible Server.
item.atom:content: Provision up to 10 read replicas in universal regions on Azure Database for MySQL - Flexible Server.

item.title: General availability: Azure SQL updates for early-October 2023
item.description: General availability enhancements and updates released for Azure SQL in early-October 2023.
item.atom:content: General availability enhancements and updates released for Azure SQL in early-October 2023.

item.title: Announcing Public Preview of Azure API Management Pricing Tiers: Basic v2 and Standard v2
item.description: We're thrilled to announce the public preview launch of our latest Azure API Management pricing tiers: Basic v2 and Standard v2. These new tiers address highly sought-after customer requests, bring quality-of-service enhancements, and offer a flexible starting point for API Management, allowing organizations of any size to embark on their API journey.
item.atom:content: We're thrilled to announce the public preview launch of our latest Azure API Management pricing tiers: Basic v2 and Standard v2. These new tiers address highly sought-after customer requests, bring quality-of-service enhancements, and offer a flexible starting point for API Management, allowing organizations of any size to embark on their API journey.

item.title: Azure Files has been improved to support all valid Unicode characters
item.description: Azure Files now supports an expanded character set enabling file and directory names with all valid Unicode characters.
item.atom:content: Azure Files now supports an expanded character set enabling file and directory names with all valid Unicode characters.

item.title: ExpressRoute Traffic Collector is now generally available
item.description: Use ExpressRoute Traffic Collector to enable collection of flow logs for traffic sent over your ExpressRoute direct circuit.
item.atom:content: Use ExpressRoute Traffic Collector to enable collection of flow logs for traffic sent over your ExpressRoute direct circuit.

item.title: LSA payload update for fixes on 15-Jan
item.description: On the 15-Jan we are going to fix those 2 values in LSA payload to contain the correct values according to our other alerts services.
item.atom:content: On the 15-Jan we are going to fix those 2 values in LSA payload to contain the correct values according to our other alerts services.

item.title: Public Preview: Azure Chaos Studio has Query-Based Dynamic Targets
item.description: Azure Chaos Studio has Query-Based Dynamic Targets.
item.atom:content: Azure Chaos Studio has Query-Based Dynamic Targets.

item.title: Migrate to Azure Resource Manager control plane API version 2021-11-01 by 30 September 2026
item.description: Older control plane APIs in Azure Service Bus, Azure Event Hubs, and Azure Relay will be retired.
item.atom:content: Older control plane APIs in Azure Service Bus, Azure Event Hubs, and Azure Relay will be retired.

item.title: Retirement notice: Bing Speech will be retired on 3 November 2023
item.description: Migrate from Bing Speech to Speech Services and the Speech SDK by 3 November 2023
item.atom:content: Migrate from Bing Speech to Speech Services and the Speech SDK by 3 November 2023

item.title: Azure Cosmos DB built-in Jupyter notebooks will be retired March 30, 2024
item.description: On 30 March 2024, the Azure Cosmos DB preview of built-in Jupyter notebooks will be retired. If you’re using notebooks to interact with your Azure Cosmos DB account, transition to run these notebooks using Visual Studio Code’s support for Jupyter notebooks, or your preferred notebooks client.
item.atom:content: On 30 March 2024, the Azure Cosmos DB preview of built-in Jupyter notebooks will be retired. If you’re using notebooks to interact with your Azure Cosmos DB account, transition to run these notebooks using Visual Studio Code’s support for Jupyter notebooks, or your preferred notebooks client.

item.title: Azure Activity Logs Legacy solution is replaced by Diagnostic settings
item.description: Deprecation of Azure Activity Logs legacy solution and auto migration
item.atom:content: Deprecation of Azure Activity Logs legacy solution and auto migration

item.title: Support for TLS 1.0/1.1 on Azure Cache for Redis ending on 30 September 2024
item.description: Azure Cache for Redis support for TLS 1.0/1.1 will be retired on 30 September 2024.
item.atom:content: Azure Cache for Redis support for TLS 1.0/1.1 will be retired on 30 September 2024.

item.title: Support for Azure Machine Learning Explanation and Fairness Dashboards is ending on 14 March 2025
item.description: The Explanation and Fairness Dashboard will be retired on 14 March 2025, please transition to the Responsible AI Dashboard (generally available) by that date. The Responsible AI dashboard will have feature parity and new additional features. You can still create and view the Explanation and Fairness dashboards with our open-source offerings (InterpretML and Fairlearn respectively), which are free for public use on GitHub and will continue to be maintained.
item.atom:content: The Explanation and Fairness Dashboard will be retired on 14 March 2025, please transition to the Responsible AI Dashboard (generally available) by that date. The Responsible AI dashboard will have feature parity and new additional features. You can still create and view the Explanation and Fairness dashboards with our open-source offerings (InterpretML and Fairlearn respectively), which are free for public use on GitHub and will continue to be maintained.

item.title: Migrate to Azure Monitor agent–based VM insights by 31 August 2024
item.description: Log Analytics agent–based VM insights will be retired.
item.atom:content: Log Analytics agent–based VM insights will be retired.

item.title: Some Azure Service Bus SDK libraries will be retired on 30 September 2026—migrate to the latest SDKs
item.description: Azure Service Bus SDK libraries that don't conform to Azure SDK guidelines will be retired and support will end.
item.atom:content: Azure Service Bus SDK libraries that don't conform to Azure SDK guidelines will be retired and support will end.

item.title: App Service: Backup and Restore over Azure Virtual Network
item.description: Customers can now use custom backups, to back up their web app's files and configuration data to a firewall-protected storage account.
item.atom:content: Customers can now use custom backups, to back up their web app's files and configuration data to a firewall-protected storage account.

item.title: Generally Available: Add an Azure Cosmos DB custom endpoint in Azure IoT Hub
item.description: Azure IoT Hub now supports the ability to setup an Azure Cosmos DB account as a custom endpoint. This will help route device data from IoT Hub to Azure Cosmos DB directly.
item.atom:content: Azure IoT Hub now supports the ability to setup an Azure Cosmos DB account as a custom endpoint. This will help route device data from IoT Hub to Azure Cosmos DB directly.

item.title: Public Preview: Customer-managed keys for Azure NetApp Files volume encryption is now available in US Gov regions (Preview)
item.description: Customer keys are protected from attacks for maximum security of their Azure NetApp File volumes; the feature is now available in US Gov regions (Preview)
item.atom:content: Customer keys are protected from attacks for maximum security of their Azure NetApp File volumes; the feature is now available in US Gov regions (Preview)

item.title: Public preview: Announcing Microsoft Playwright Testing service: Scalable end-to-end testing for modern web apps
item.description:
Now in preview: Microsoft Playwright Testing, a new service for running Playwright tests easily at scale.
Playwright, a fast-growing, open-source framework, enables reliable end-to-end testing and automation for modern web apps. Microsoft Playwright Testing service uses the cloud, enabling you to simultaneously run Playwright tests with much higher parallelization across different operating system-browser combinations. Learn more https://aka.ms/MPT/about
item.atom:content:
Now in preview: Microsoft Playwright Testing, a new service for running Playwright tests easily at scale.
Playwright, a fast-growing, open-source framework, enables reliable end-to-end testing and automation for modern web apps. Microsoft Playwright Testing service uses the cloud, enabling you to simultaneously run Playwright tests with much higher parallelization across different operating system-browser combinations. Learn more https://aka.ms/MPT/about

item.title: General Availability: Upgrade your existing Azure Gen2 VMs to Trusted Launch
item.description: Enable Trusted Launch foundational compute security on existing Azure Generation 2 VMs.
item.atom:content: Enable Trusted Launch foundational compute security on existing Azure Generation 2 VMs.

item.title: General availability: Microsoft Azure now available from new cloud region in Italy
item.description: Microsoft launched its first cloud region in Italy.
item.atom:content: Microsoft launched its first cloud region in Italy.

item.title: Generally Available: Multi-user authorisation for Backup vaults
item.description: Multi-user authorization provides enhanced protection for your backup data against unauthorized critical operations.
item.atom:content: Multi-user authorization provides enhanced protection for your backup data against unauthorized critical operations.

item.title: Generally available: Enhanced soft delete for Azure Backup
item.description: Enhanced soft delete helps you recover your backup data even after it has been deleted, giving you protection against data loss scenarios like ransomwares, malicious actors, and accidental deletes.
item.atom:content: Enhanced soft delete helps you recover your backup data even after it has been deleted, giving you protection against data loss scenarios like ransomwares, malicious actors, and accidental deletes.

item.title: Public Preview: Azure Log Alerts support for Azure Resource Graph (ARG)
item.description: We are now introducing support for running queries also on Azure Resource Graph (ARG) tables, and even joining data between Azure Resource Graph (ARG) data sources from your Log Analytics workspace and Application Insights resources in a single query.
item.atom:content: We are now introducing support for running queries also on Azure Resource Graph (ARG) tables, and even joining data between Azure Resource Graph (ARG) data sources from your Log Analytics workspace and Application Insights resources in a single query.

item.title: Transition to the ContainerLogV2 table by 30 September 2026

If you currently ingest container insights data to the ContainerLog table, please make sure to transition to using ContainerLogV2 prior to that date.
item.atom:content: With the upgraded offering of ContainerLogV2 becoming generally available, on 30th September 2026, the ContainerLog table will be retired. If you currently ingest container insights data to the ContainerLog table, please make sure to transition to using ContainerLogV2 prior to that date.

item.title: Azure Virtual Desktop (classic) will be retired on 30 September 2026 - Please transition to Azure Virtual Desktop
item.description:
Because Azure Virtual Desktop (classic) will retire on 30 September 2026, please transition to Azure Virtual Desktop by that date.

Azure Virtual Desktop fully replaces Azure Virtual Desktop (classic). Azure Virtual Desktop includes, but isn’t limited to, the following benefits: • Deployments via Azure Resource Manager • Unified resource management • Improved networking and security • Scaling and automation features • Feature availability and updates
item.atom:content:
Because Azure Virtual Desktop (classic) will retire on 30 September 2026, please transition to Azure Virtual Desktop by that date.

Azure Virtual Desktop fully replaces Azure Virtual Desktop (classic). Azure Virtual Desktop includes, but isn’t limited to, the following benefits: • Deployments via Azure Resource Manager • Unified resource management • Improved networking and security • Scaling and automation features • Feature availability and updates

item.title: App Service Environment version 1 and version 2 will be retired on 31 August 2024

item.atom:content: Migrate to Azure Computer Vision 3.2 API before 13 September 2026

item.title: SMART on FHIR proxy feature in Azure Health Data Services will be retired on 21st September 2026 - Transition to SMART on FHIR (Enhanced).
item.description: SMART on FHIR proxy feature in Azure Health Data Services will be retired on 21st September 2026 - Transition to SMART on FHIR (Enhanced) to enable SMART on FHIR scenarios.

item.title: Upgrade Azure Database for MySQL to MySQL v8.0 before support for v5.7 ends

item.atom:content: Oracle retiring MySQL v5.7 on Oct 31, 2023. Azure extending support for Single Server until Sep 16, 2024, and Flexible Server until Sep 30, 2025. Upgrade to MySQL v8.0 advised.

item.atom:content: Protect the sensitive data getting stored in your Web Application Firewall (WAF) using log scrubbing on Azure’s regional Web Application Firewall running on Application Gateway.

item.title: Generally available: Higher default value for Azure Functions Event Hubs max batch size
item.description: Starting with version 6.0.0 of the Azure Functions Event Hubs extension, a higher default value of 100 will be used for max batch size
item.atom:content: Starting with version 6.0.0 of the Azure Functions Event Hubs extension, a higher default value of 100 will be used for max batch size

item.title: General availability: Use Azure Key Vault to securely store and retrieve access key when mounting Azure Storage as a local share in App Service
item.description:
You can now use Azure Key Vault to securely store and retrieve Azure Storage account access key when mounting it as a local share in App Service. Azure Key Vault has the benefits of storing application secrets centrally and securely with the ability to monitor, administer, and integrate with other Azure services like Azure App Service.
This feature is available for App Service Linux code and container, Windows containers and Windows code.
Please refer to https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/app-service/configure-connect-to-azure-storage?tabs=key-vault%2Ccli&pivots=container-linux for more details.
item.atom:content:
You can now use Azure Key Vault to securely store and retrieve Azure Storage account access key when mounting it as a local share in App Service. Azure Key Vault has the benefits of storing application secrets centrally and securely with the ability to monitor, administer, and integrate with other Azure services like Azure App Service.
This feature is available for App Service Linux code and container, Windows containers and Windows code.
Please refer to https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/app-service/configure-connect-to-azure-storage?tabs=key-vault%2Ccli&pivots=container-linux for more details.

item.atom:content: Azure Premium SSD v2 Disk Storage is now available in more regions and offers the most advanced general-purpose block storage solution with the best price performance

item.atom:content: This feature allows you to upgrade your firewall without service downtime, with a single click of a button.

item.title: Azure Firewall: Poland Central Region is now in general availability

item.atom:content: Azure Firewall is now generally available in the Poland Central region.

item.title: Azure Firewall: Explicit Proxy is now in public preview
item.description: This configuration allows traffic from the sending application to be directed to the private IP address of the firewall, facilitating direct egress from the firewall without the need for a UDR.
item.atom:content: This configuration allows traffic from the sending application to be directed to the private IP address of the firewall, facilitating direct egress from the firewall without the need for a UDR.

item.title: Azure Firewall: Auto-Learn SNAT routes feature is now in public preview
item.description: Azure Firewall can now learn address ranges and automatically configure them to be excluded from SNAT, to reduce time and complexity spent manually defining SNAT private ranges.
item.atom:content: Azure Firewall can now learn address ranges and automatically configure them to be excluded from SNAT, to reduce time and complexity spent manually defining SNAT private ranges.

item.title: Generally Available: Trusted launch as default for VMs deployed through the Azure portal
item.description: Trusted launch is now enabled by default for VMS deployed through the Azure portal, enhancing the foundational security of these VMs.
item.atom:content: Trusted launch is now enabled by default for VMS deployed through the Azure portal, enhancing the foundational security of these VMs.

item.atom:content: Azure Functions now supports .NET 8 preview 7, using the isolated worker model.

item.title: Public Preview: Azure Container Apps supports environment level mTLS encryption
item.description: You can now encrypt traffic transmitted between applications within an environment using mTLS.
item.atom:content: You can now encrypt traffic transmitted between applications within an environment using mTLS.

item.title: Generally available: Azure Container Apps jobs
item.description: You can now run production workloads that perform a task for a finite duration and exit, and schedule these workloads or run them in response to events.
item.atom:content: You can now run production workloads that perform a task for a finite duration and exit, and schedule these workloads or run them in response to events.

item.title: Public preview: Azure Container Apps supports additional TCP ports
item.description: You can now run applications that accept TCP connections on multiple ports.
item.atom:content: You can now run applications that accept TCP connections on multiple ports.

item.title: Generally Available: Azure Container Apps support for UDR, NAT Gateway, and smaller subnets
item.description: You can now define UDRs to manage how outbound traffic is routed for your container app environment’s subnet.
item.atom:content: You can now define UDRs to manage how outbound traffic is routed for your container app environment’s subnet.

item.title: Public preview: Azure Functions .NET worker cold start improvements
item.description: Major cold start improvements are available to .NET apps on the Azure Functions isolated worker model through a preview configuration.
item.atom:content: Major cold start improvements are available to .NET apps on the Azure Functions isolated worker model through a preview configuration.

item.title: Generally available: Azure Container Apps dedicated plan
item.description: You can now run your apps on dedicated workload profiles that offer more CPU and memory if needed.
item.atom:content: You can now run your apps on dedicated workload profiles that offer more CPU and memory if needed.

item.title: Generally Available: ASP.NET Core integration in Azure Functions
item.description: Azure Functions now supports using ASP.NET types such as HttpRequest, HttpResponse, and IActionResult from .NET isolated function projects.
item.atom:content: Azure Functions now supports using ASP.NET types such as HttpRequest, HttpResponse, and IActionResult from .NET isolated function projects.

item.title: Generally Available: Auto-upgrade scheduled maintenance for AKS
item.description: You can now have dedicated maintenance for weekly AKS releases, auto upgrades and Node OS patching.
item.atom:content: You can now have dedicated maintenance for weekly AKS releases, auto upgrades and Node OS patching.

item.title: General availability: Azure SQL updates for late-August 2023
item.description: General availability enhancements and updates released for Azure SQL in late-August 2023.
item.atom:content: General availability enhancements and updates released for Azure SQL in late-August 2023.

item.title: Generally available: Latest PostgreSQL minor versions supported by Azure Database for PostgreSQL – Flexible Server
item.description: Azure Database for PostgreSQL – Flexible Server now supports minor versions 15.3, 14.8, 13.11, 12.15, 11.20.
item.atom:content: Azure Database for PostgreSQL – Flexible Server now supports minor versions 15.3, 14.8, 13.11, 12.15, 11.20.

item.title: Public Preview: Universal geo restore on Azure Database for MySQL- Flexible Server
item.description: Restore Azure Database for MySQL – Flexible Server to any Azure supported region.
item.atom:content: Restore Azure Database for MySQL – Flexible Server to any Azure supported region.

item.title: Public Preview – Azure Portal experience for Azure Database Migration Service
item.description: The new Azure Portal experience for Azure Database Migration Service (DMS) allows you to perform seamless migrations from SQL Server on-premises to Azure SQL targets using DMS.
item.atom:content: The new Azure Portal experience for Azure Database Migration Service (DMS) allows you to perform seamless migrations from SQL Server on-premises to Azure SQL targets using DMS.

item.title: Generally available: Azure Site Recovery Higher Churn Support
item.description: Azure Site Recovery High Churn Support
item.atom:content: Azure Site Recovery High Churn Support

item.title: Preview: Export Cost Management data to secure storage accounts with firewall
item.description: Export Cost Management data to secure storage accounts with firewall
item.atom:content: Export Cost Management data to secure storage accounts with firewall

item.title: Azure App Configuration - public preview release of snapshots feature
item.description: Key-value pairs from App Config store ensure controlled deployments.
item.atom:content: Key-value pairs from App Config store ensure controlled deployments.

item.title: Azure Logic Apps (Standard): Upgrade to Node 18 LTS by 11 September 2023
item.description: Support for Node 16 LTS is ending on 11 September 2023. Any application hosted on Azure Logic Apps that relies on this version will not be supported and must be upgraded to Node 18 LTS by 11 September 2023.
item.atom:content: Support for Node 16 LTS is ending on 11 September 2023. Any application hosted on Azure Logic Apps that relies on this version will not be supported and must be upgraded to Node 18 LTS by 11 September 2023.

item.title: Retirement: Kubernetes 1.24 support in AKS
item.description: Migrate to Kubernetes 1.25 or higher in AKS.
item.atom:content: Migrate to Kubernetes 1.25 or higher in AKS.

item.title: General Availability: Improve VM resiliency with Azure Advisor's Availability Zone recommendation.
item.description: Avoid downtime and business interruptions by migrating your virtual machines to availability zones
item.atom:content: Avoid downtime and business interruptions by migrating your virtual machines to availability zones

item.title: Quick create Azure Front Door endpoints for Azure Storage accounts
item.description: Azure Storage is announcing native integration with Azure Front Door for content delivery with blob storage as your origin
item.atom:content: Azure Storage is announcing native integration with Azure Front Door for content delivery with blob storage as your origin

item.title: General Availability: AzAcSnap 9 — Azure Application Consistent Snapshot tool updates
item.description: AzAcSnap Version 9 Release
item.atom:content: AzAcSnap Version 9 Release
